docs.text: it is an understood passion and an understood calm .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bud white walks into the home of lynn bracken , a prostitute " cut to look like veronica lake . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's one of l . a . 's finest investigating the murder of fellow cop , and one of the leads takes him to her home .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's understood that he is quiet thunder , a guy who's calm voice is more powerful than his arms .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's understood that she's supposed to be beautiful , but underneath her face is pain and scraped out lines that say her life could have been so much more .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you know without having to be told .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " you're the first guy who hasn't told me i look like veronicca lake in under a minute , " she says .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " you look ten times better . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he says it without thinking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: like he knows without her having to say anything .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: white's face doesn't turn , it doesn't blush .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you see his eyes , and you believe him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a perfect moment in a near perfect movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: l . a . confidential is the best movie of the year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is grace and poetry ; a richly layered work of pure entertainment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is a portrait of police and morality as it works it's way through characters that are so real on screen that you believe that they might have a soul .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a phrase , it is everything .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is funny , it is exciting , has enough action and adventure and mystery and grace and suspense .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is the pinnacle of a movie , a complete work , a flawless film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's hard to tell you about the plot , because it's about so much more than plot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besides , there's too much to describe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sure , it's about police and searching for corruption and who fights for the right reasons and the definition of justice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but it's also about what you feel when you look into the eyes of the characters in the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director curtis hanson has perfectly framed each character , letting you see into them , rooting for them one moment , doubting them the next .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the actors work with their lines , but in this movie their most important weapon is their eyes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you can tell what each person is feeling just by looking into their eyes for one moment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: russell crowe plays bud white , a muscle cop with a beef for wife beaters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his movements are fierce .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when he strikes , you jump , when he's calm , you know it won't be for long .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his intensity oozes out of the screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you follow his character through the movie afraid of him , but in sympathy of him , because you know how good his heart is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's looking for a way to solve crimes , you're just never sure how he's going to do it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his counter is ed exley , played with a chisselled face by guy pierce .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you feel for him , for his character , because of all the cops in the movie he's the one that's actually trying to do the right thing by going by the book .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you know that he must face the reality of breaking the book , and you love the way he gets there .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i've seen l . a confidential twice , immediately after it was over , i wanted to hit the rewind button and watch it again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i didn't want the theater experience to end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's been a long time since i actually experienced a movie , feeling like i got something after i walked out .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's why i love movies ; the great ones can be too rich and powerful to describe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: watch l . a . confidential : after you leave the theater , you feel like you just watched a classic movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's why la confidential stands as the best movie of the year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: l . a . confidential ( directed by curtis hanson .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: starring russell crowe , guy pierce , kevin spacey , james cromwell , and kim basinger .
